Michael Bryant

About

I earned a BS in physics and a thesis-based MS in applied physics. During my education, I took multiple programming courses which used MATLAB, C, and assembly language. After my master's, in 2019, I started working at Los Alamos National Laboratory as a research associate in an experimental materials engineering group. My research at Los Alamos involved analyzing experimental data. To produce better analyses, I began self-studying data science and Python. I returned to university after a year at Los Alamos as a research and teaching assistant.

In 2021, I left the university to work at my family's accounting firm as a bookkeeper. During 2021 and 2022, I continued to study topics relevant to data science such as database design, SQL, data structures and algorithms, and REST APIs. During this time, I deployed a few of my machine learning models as web apps (using Flask). Since doing so, I have been focusing my studies on web development. My most recent coding experience is with HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, and Python using React and Django frameworks.
